intro: Cotula venosa, commonly known as the veined cotula, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are usually hairy and have a distinctive veining pattern, while its flowers are yellow with white centers. Cotula venosa is often used in traditional medicine and as a ornamental plant due to its hardy nature and attractive appearance.
